RESOLVED_ENTITIES.rebuttal witnesses: Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father and Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.U.S. Government Attorney rebuttal witnes: Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father and Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the U.S. Government Attorney and Alfredo: U.S. Government Attorney and Alfredo Ortega-Chavez
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Juan Gonzalez Torres and Josefina Contre: Juan Gonzalez Torres and Josefina Contreras de Gonzalez

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: persons being smuggled into the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.five undocumented aliens: undocumented immigrants being smuggled, transported in a hidden van compartment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: defendant and appellant in a case involving conspiracy and aiding and abetting the smuggling of undocumented aliens into the United States
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Graciela Castaneda: witness for Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, provided alibi testimony stating he was in San Antonio, Texas on the day in question
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father: rebuttal witness testifying against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's alibi, placing him in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 22, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's mother: rebuttal witness testifying against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's alibi, recalling having seen him in Sabinas Hidalgo on the evening of November 21, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Government Attorney: prosecutor in the case against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, responsible for disclosing witness information
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's father and Ramo: rebuttal witnesses whose testimony confirmed Alfredo Ortega-Chavez was in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 21 and 22, thus rebutting Graciela Castaneda's alibi
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ms. Salinas' law firm: law firm representing Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, declined to question Mrs. Guerrero about potential conflict of interest, introduced Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez's deposition testimony in evidence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: trial judge who instructed the jury to disregard his opinions and focus on legal instructions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mrs. Guerrero: juror who indicated she could remain fair and impartial despite relationship with Ms. Salinas' law firm
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Government Attorney and Alfredo Ort: parties in the trial, subject to inquiry regarding juror impartiality
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ramon Gonzalez Sanchez: accomplice witness whose testimony revealed inconsistencies but was not incredible as a matter of law, provided deposition testimony implicating Alfredo Ortega-Chavez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court presiding over Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's trial, responsible for enforcing disclosure rules and excluding undisclosed witnesses
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juan Gonzalez Torres: witness who testified seeing Alfredo Ortega-Chavez in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 21, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Josefina Contreras de Gonzalez: witness who testified seeing Alfredo Ortega-Chavez in Sabinas Hidalgo on the evening of November 21, 1980
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the hidden compartment: secret space within the van used for smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Government Attorney rebuttal witnes: rebuttal witnesses whose testimony confirmed Alfredo Ortega-Chavez was in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 21 and 22, thus rebutting Graciela Castaneda's alibi
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juan Gonzalez Torres and Josefina Contre: witnesses testifying against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez's alibi, placing him in Sabinas Hidalgo on November 21, 1980
